this solution you found is so ridiculous that I won't argue with it, in fact
it could be rather humorous.

Ignatius heard a voice in the room, somehow one of the bots were speaking.
"Who said that? he asked becoming a little more paranoid. "I'll find you and
when I do you will never speak again." the voice had to be there somewhere.
He didn't know how they'd avoided the Stasis field but there would be
ramifications.

A smell of burning metal was scanned by the computer, "Something seems
amiss, I scan something burning." the floor was melting slowly but Ignatius
was again getting paniced by the situation.
----- Original Message -----
From: <Rudra656@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 13, 2001 4:07 PM
Subject: Re: The deal


> ::Cygnar::
>     He stood inside the Trainer ship.  Well it wasn't exacty standing.  He
> just happened to be upright on the floor.  He had no way of moving.  He
was
> acctually quite bored.  He needed someone to talk to or fight with or
> something.  He could still breath and his mouth was open but he couldn't
> properly form words.  As a young bot he had practiced the lost art of
> ventriloquy.  He decided to try his hand at it again.  "Is hare any way to
> hurn his off?"  (I figured it out, this can be said easily without moving
the
> mouth or tounge.)
>
>
